Food production and distribution industries would be dismantled, leading to significant economic changes and job losses.
Cities and urban planning would need to be reimagined, as the need for food production and distribution would no longer be a driving factor in their design.
The way people interact with their environment and each other would change, as the shared experience of eating and cooking would no longer be a central part of daily life.
The cultural and social aspects of food would be significantly altered, as the act of sharing meals and the associated rituals and traditions would no longer be necessary.
The way people perceive and value their health and well-being would change, as the act of eating and the associated health benefits would no longer be a central part of daily life.
